arcade.patch.env.component

Class PatchComponentSitesSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • arcade.patch.env.component.PatchComponentSites
      • arcade.patch.env.component.PatchComponentSitesSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable

    public class PatchComponentSitesSource
extends PatchComponentSites
    Extension of PatchComponentSites for source sites.

    Each index in the lattice can be assigned as a source, depending on the initial spacings in the x direction (length, X_SPACING), y direction (width, Y_SPACING), and z direction (height, Z_SPACING). Each spacing can be defined as:

    • * = all indices in the lattice
    • x or X = no indices in the lattice
    • *:INC = all indices in the lattice incremented by INC (i = 0, INC, 2*INC, ... , n*INC) where n*INC ≤ lattice size
    • INDEX = only index INDEX
    • MIN:MAX = all indices between MIN and MAX, inclusive
    • MIN:INC:MAX = all indices between MIN and MAX incremented by INC (i = MIN, MIN + INC, MIN + 2*INC, ... , MIN + n*INC) where MIN + n*INC ≤ MAX

    Setting all spacings to * creates a constant source. Setting any spacings to x removes all sites.

    The amount of concentration added to each index is the difference between the concentration at the index and the source concentration of the molecule. Sites can be damaged by setting the DAMAGE_SCALING parameter, which reduces the amount of concentration added at each index.

    See Also:

      • PatchComponentSitesSource

        public PatchComponentSitesSource(Series series,
                                 MiniBox parameters)
        Creates a PatchComponentSites using source sites.

        Loaded parameters include:

        • X_SPACING = spacing of sources in x direction
        • Y_SPACING = spacing of sources in y direction
        • Z_SPACING = spacing of sources in z direction
        • DAMAGE_SCALING = source site damage scaling
        Parameters:
        series - the simulation series
        parameters - the component parameters dictionary

        void initializeSourceArray()
        Initializes sites in source array.

        Iterates through each index in the source lattice and assigns it as a source site or not, depending on the specified spacings.
